posts.post_content: Banned in Modern, not necessarily for being overpowered or for showing up in all the decks, but because its specific land requirements wound up making most of the decks the same. Yes [Tarmogoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tarmogoyf) is overpowered and sees play everywhere, but that 'everywhere' is a wide range of different builds and play styles. [Wild Nacatl](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Nacatl) fits into only one build, being just good enough at what it does to force all the Modern aggro decks into ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) Naya "Zoo", killing all hope for aggro diversity, and ironically making a drawback with no conceivable upside the root cause of the card's ban.
posts.html:
Banned in Modern, not necessarily for being overpowered or for showing up in all the decks, but because its specific land requirements wound up making most of the decks the same. Yes Tarmogoyf is overpowered and sees play everywhere, but that 'everywhere' is a wide range of different builds and play styles. Wild Nacatl fits into only one build, being just good enough at what it does to force all the Modern aggro decks into Naya "Zoo", killing all hope for aggro diversity, and ironically making a drawback with no conceivable upside the root cause of the card's ban.
Report Abuse

posts.post_content:
@Plaguestinger - Sunpetal Grove doesn't have the types 'forest' or 'plains', so it doesn't contribute to Wild Nacatl, Loam Lion or Kird Ape. If you want a nonbasic with multiple land types, you need to look at either the Ravnica shocklands (ie. Temple Garden) or the alpha duals (ie. Savannah).  
  
In any case, a 2/2 for one in GR or GW decks isn't terrible, but a 3/3 for 1 in Naya decks (or 4/5c decks, or 2c decks splashing a mountain/plains for the pump) is just awesome. If you're looking for an aggressive one drop, he's a standard. He also makes Ranger of Eos swoon ("yes, I will fetch you 6 points of power with my ETB").
posts.html:
@Plaguestinger - Sunpetal Grove doesn't have the types 'forest' or 'plains', so it doesn't contribute to Wild Nacatl, Loam Lion or Kird Ape. If you want a nonbasic with multiple land types, you need to look at either the Ravnica shocklands (ie. Temple Garden) or the alpha duals (ie. Savannah).

In any case, a 2/2 for one in GR or GW decks isn't terrible, but a 3/3 for 1 in Naya decks (or 4/5c decks, or 2c decks splashing a mountain/plains for the pump) is just awesome. If you're looking for an aggressive one drop, he's a standard. He also makes Ranger of Eos swoon ("yes, I will fetch you 6 points of power with my ETB").

posts.post_content:
A 1-drop 3/3 if you have 3 specific lands: banned.
  
A 1-drop 3/2 FLYER in a color that can easily make you draw an instant or sorcery on the next turn: not epic enough for a ban.
  
   
Granted, Minus\_Prime does explain why Wild Nacatl got banned but still... what's the difference between everyone playing ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) and everyone splashing ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). Not much, everyone is playing roughly the same strategy with a few alternate win cons.
posts.html:
A 1-drop 3/3 if you have 3 specific lands: banned.
A 1-drop 3/2 FLYER in a color that can easily make you draw an instant or sorcery on the next turn: not epic enough for a ban.

Granted, Minus_Prime does explain why Wild Nacatl got banned but still... what's the difference between everyone playing and everyone splashing . Not much, everyone is playing roughly the same strategy with a few alternate win cons.
